featured.title: Yang Hansen Makes NBA Debut with Portland Trail Blazers in Summer League
featured.summary: Chinese center Yang Hansen, standing at 7'1", made his highly anticipated NBA debut with the Portland Trail Blazers in the Las Vegas Summer League, showcasing his versatility and basketball IQ.
featured.content:
Yang Hansen, the 7-foot-1 center from China, officially began his NBA journey with the Portland Trail Blazers during the 2025 Las Vegas Summer League. The 20-year-old rookie, who was drafted 16th overall in the 2025 NBA Draft, demonstrated his potential as a modern big man with his ability to stretch the floor and facilitate offense.

In his debut performance, Hansen recorded 12 points, 8 rebounds, and 4 assists while shooting 3-of-5 from three-point range. His performance drew comparisons to other international big men who have successfully transitioned to the NBA.

'Yang has all the tools to be successful in this league,' said Blazers Summer League coach. 'His basketball IQ, combined with his size and shooting ability, makes him a unique prospect.'

Hansen's path to the NBA began in China's youth basketball system before joining the CBA, where he quickly established himself as one of the league's most promising young talents.
featured.author: NBA.com

articles.title: Draft Analysis: Why Portland Selected Yang Hansen 16th Overall
articles.summary: Breaking down the Portland Trail Blazers' decision to draft Chinese center Yang Hansen with the 16th pick in the 2025 NBA Draft.
articles.content:
The Portland Trail Blazers surprised many by selecting Yang Hansen with the 16th overall pick in the 2025 NBA Draft, but the decision reflects the organization's commitment to finding versatile big men who can adapt to the modern NBA.

At 7'1" with a 7'4" wingspan, Hansen brings a unique skill set that includes three-point shooting, court vision, and defensive instincts. His performance in the CBA, where he averaged 15.2 points, 9.8 rebounds, and 3.1 assists per game, demonstrated his readiness for professional basketball.

'Yang represents the future of basketball,' said Blazers GM Joe Cronin. 'He can play multiple positions, has excellent basketball IQ, and brings an international perspective that will benefit our team culture.'
articles.author: ESPN

articles.title: From CBA Rising Star to NBA Prospect: Yang Hansen's Journey
articles.summary: Tracing Yang Hansen's remarkable rise from Chinese basketball youth programs to becoming an NBA draft prospect.
articles.content:
Yang Hansen's journey to the NBA began in the youth basketball programs of Shandong Province, China. His exceptional height and natural basketball instincts quickly set him apart from his peers.

After joining the CBA at age 18, Hansen made an immediate impact, earning Rookie of the Year honors and establishing himself as one of the league's most promising young talents. His ability to shoot from beyond the arc while maintaining traditional center skills made him a unique prospect.

'Yang's development has been remarkable,' said his former CBA coach. 'He has the work ethic and basketball IQ to succeed at any level.'

His success in the CBA, combined with strong performances in international competitions, caught the attention of NBA scouts and ultimately led to his selection by Portland.
articles.author: The Athletic

articles.title: Yang Hansen's Impact on International Basketball Relations
articles.summary: How Yang Hansen's NBA journey represents a new chapter in China-NBA basketball relations.
articles.content:
Yang Hansen's selection in the NBA Draft represents more than just individual achievement—it symbolizes the evolving relationship between Chinese basketball and the NBA.

As one of the most promising Chinese prospects in recent years, Hansen carries the hopes of basketball fans across China. His success could pave the way for increased basketball cooperation between the two countries.

'Yang represents the best of both basketball cultures,' said international basketball analyst. 'He brings Chinese basketball fundamentals combined with modern NBA skills.'

His presence in the NBA is expected to boost viewership in China and create new opportunities for basketball development programs.
articles.author: Sports Illustrated

articles.title: How Yang Hansen Fits into Portland's Future Plans
articles.summary: Analyzing how Yang Hansen's skill set aligns with the Portland Trail Blazers' long-term strategy.
articles.content:
The Portland Trail Blazers' selection of Yang Hansen reflects their commitment to building around versatile, skilled big men who can adapt to multiple playing styles.

Hansen's ability to stretch the floor with his three-point shooting while maintaining traditional center skills makes him an ideal fit for Portland's system. His court vision and passing ability add another dimension to the team's offensive capabilities.

'Yang gives us flexibility in how we approach games,' said Blazers head coach. 'He can play alongside other big men or as our primary center, depending on matchups.'

The organization views Hansen as a cornerstone piece for their future, with plans to develop his skills gradually while allowing him to contribute immediately in specific situations.
articles.author: Blazers Edge
